review1.reviewText: My Weber grill cover couldn't make it 2 years in the Chicago winter and summer. After reading reviews and taking measurements I ended up going with the large size (the color was the closest matching for my patio).  It doesn't fit like a glove but it isn't too loose (Maybe 1-2" too big length wise). I was worried about the depth not being enough but there isn't an issue there. It hangs about a 1/2 inch off the ground (lower than the Weber cover). Towards the first snow I'll tighten up the bottom strap. It has survived a few normal rain/thunderstorms without blowing off and protected the grill.I'll update my review in the future.[Update April, 2014]The cover survived a harsh cold winter, and more importantly my grill survived. TL;DR:
review1.summary: A replacement for a weber genesis

review2.reviewText: I've owned several grill covers in my lifetime, and none of them quite stacked up to the quality, durability, and design of this one.  Yes, it is heavy weight, which one would expect of a premium grill cover.  But the quality does not stop here.  It is sewn well with stitching that seems to be built to last.  But what really makes this grill cover stand out to me are the unique features that you will not find in most grill covers.  First, the straps that can be secured around each leg of your grill are ingenious.  This means no more improvised inventions to keep the cover on your grill in storms or high winds.  You need not secure the cover on all 4 corners, but even one or two corners will ensure that it's not going anywhere when the wind starts blowing.  The zippered pocket that faces the front is pretty cool.  I am not sure what I will keep in there, but it's a neat feature.  Lastly, though I have seen them on some other covers, too, the sturdy handles for lifting and positioning the grill cover are great.  Again, they seem to be built with longevity in mind.  One quality that is too early to test is whether the cover will fade or discolor in the sun so badly, like other grill covers I have owned.  My only minor complaint is probably my own fault.  I own a Char Broil grill with a griddle on one side of the fire box and a shelf on the other side.  I thought for sure I should get the XL cover, but it actually seems a bit TOO LARGE.  I can live with it, though.  You might want to actually measure your grill, rather than guessing, as I did. TL;DR:
generated: Great looking and functional, but not great in every sense

review3.reviewText: The Ravenna Grill Cover is impressive in its construction and seems a good value for the price. Over the years, I have paid the same amount and more for grill covers with nowhere near the quality of this one. The package states that the main body is 100% woven polyester with laminated polyvinyl chloride backing and a hem casing of 100% polyester. The seams are double stitched, as well as the handles which make removing the cover easy. The cinch cord on the bottom has kept it from blowing off in several very strong wind gusts. You'll want to make allowances for the fact that sizes seem to run large. It remains to be seen how it will hold up to the summer sun in southern Arizona, but it does come with a four year replacement warranty through the manufacturer. I am optimistic, judging by the overall quality. TL;DR:
generated: Nice Looking, But It does NOT Cover A Solid Fabric

review4.reviewText: Super heavy duty material and construction, it even has a front pouch for BBQ weapons (ok. they say 'tools').The Medium size comfortably covers my 30 cal.(oops "inch") grill, with one side clip (I mean side "tray") extended, and my tucked-in 40 round LP cylinder (sorry again- that's "pound").Quick release straps at the bottom corners is to secure the cover to the wheels/feet to prevent blow-away. Nice for the off season, or to use as an improvised HALO 'chute, but too painful to use for regular duty. Integral handles and side vents are nice too- especially handy when dragging your rig through the bush.4 year warranty means save the paperwork with your printed receipt. I put mine a ziploc bag, and put that in the handy zippered pouch on the front of the cover. OO-RAH! TL;DR:
generated: Handy Tool. Not bad (but not super lightweight either).

review5.reviewText: Though not designed for a large smoker with a tall smoke stack, we decided to try using this x-large grill cover for just that purpose; so far, so good. The generous size covers the full length & width of the smoker and nearly the entire height, leaving only the bottom of the legs exposed. Because the grill cover was designed for a normally shaped grill, we knew there would be sections that didn't fit snugly and expected to have to use bungee cords to secure the bottom of the cover. To our surprise, the straps sewn into the bottom of the cover pull tightly enough to keep it in place. We have strong south winds, routinely gusting more than 35 mph for extended periods of time and so far, we've only had to adjust the cover & retighten the straps once. And even though it had loosened, the cover did not blow off.So far, the only element that has blasted the cover is wind; though we have had rain, it hasn't been prolonged and no hail, ice, snow yet. Given the quality construction of this cover, I am feeling pretty positive that it will hold up to the worst mother nature throws its way. Will update later if I am proven wrong. TL;DR:
review5.summary: Secure outdoor cover for our oddly shaped smoker

review6.reviewText: Having built a patio out back, I moved my grill out of the garage to store it outside. I bought theChar-Broil 65" Artisan Grill Cover - Mountain Greenfor it when I bought the grill, but it was a little shorter than the grill, although it fit well otherwise. I decided to try the X-Large Classic Accessories 55-142-055101-EC Ravenna Grill Cover in taupe with myChar-Broil 4-Burner 48,000 BTU Gas Grill, with Side burner.The Ravenna cover is plain, but still attractive. More importantly, it feels and looks very durable, which is exactly what I want to cover a grill outside. It is large enough that there is no part of the grill exposed to the elements, and the bottom tightens up to keep the fit snug. The Char-Broil cover had a tendency to blow half off of the grill when it was windy, but the Ravenna cover has stayed put even with the storms we've had here lately.I checked the grill after one storm subsided and found that the grill underneath the cover was still dry, even though it had poured for a couple of hours. VERY nice.There is a zipper pocket near the top of the cover. I haven't yet figured what to keep in it, but it is nice to have just in case. My favorite, however, is the handles it has on either end of the top. They make it easy to get a good grip on the cover when you pull it off of your grill.I am extremely pleased with this cover and would recommend it to anyone who wants to keep their grill outdoors. TL;DR:
review6.summary: Durable grill cover does a great job protecting my grill from the elements
generated: Looks very nice, fits my grill perfectly

review7.reviewText: My first grill cover for my new Weber grill was from Sears. It lasted about 6 months way down south here in our blazing heat. Moving on from that experience, I thought I'd try a genuine Weber cover for my Weber grill. It was pretty expensive but seemed heavier duty than the Sears. After 18 months it had simply shrunk down too much to get it on or off the grill without having to stretch it. Also, it became very stiff and even brittle. Sure enough, soon it ripped.Having learned that big brand names don't mean much when it comes to grill covers, I came across this Ravenna cover. It is very heavy for a cover. I think that's because it's made of cloth instead of plastic.It fits in an unusual way. When you check among the 3 available sizes you can see that they all have the same height. Mine actually touches the ground all around the grill. It has locking straps that can be looped around the rollers to keep the cover down in the event of some calamity that will likely blow away my home before this cover breaks loose from the grill. As if that is not "fastened" enough, you can also pull the cords at the bottom to cinch it up even further like an upside-down tobacco pouch.That fastening system is too much bother for me. The weight and length of this cover keeps it down just fine. I'm sure some folks will love fastening theirs down but some will be like me and not want to bother with it. Just a matter of opinion on that and I'm not scoring the cover down for this.I have one complaint. My cover looks like it was stitched together by someone whose machine either was jamming or who was careless in keeping the spool and bobbin full. Some seams stop in mid track and in other places seams have stitched over long dangly loops of thread. It really looks poor. I question what the use of being able to securely fasten the cover down with straps and cords when it looks like a strong tug will pull some of these seams apart.I went to a school where I had to take a sewing class. If this cover were my assignment there, I'd not have gotten a passing grade on it. In fact, I'm sure I would have gotten a lecture from the teacher on being so careless in my work.Having said that, I'll keep the cover but must knock it down from 5 stars to 3. It seems to be very heavy duty cover but I'm disappointed that mine is stitched together so poorly. TL;DR:
review7.summary: A lot of cover for the money but mine is poorly stitched

review8.reviewText: The Ravenna grill cover is a high quality grill cover that appears to be ready to weather the elements over the long haul.  I installed the medium size version of this cover on my Weber Silver B grill.  In the past I've always used the Weber 7573 premium covers and those have served me well.The Ravenna cover is a clear step up in quality and materials versus the Weber cover.  For starters, the Ravenna cover has a much heavier feel.  On the outside it has a heavy-vinyl like feel, similar to the Weber premium cover.  On the inside, the Ravenna cover has an entirely separate heavy-plastic layer that the Weber cover doesn't have.There are a number of vents to allow wind to pass through without lifting the cover off the grill.  In each case, the vents are constructed so that rain would actually have to blow upwards in order to get under the cover.  The Ravenna grill cover also has a simple and easy-to-use strapping system along the bottom that allows you to cinch it around the bottom of your grill stand so that no amount of wind can blow it away.The Weber premium cover typically lasts me about 24 months of outdoor use in the brutal Texas sun before I have to replace.  Only time will tell how the Ravenna grill cover will fare, but given the construction quality, I expect at least that length of time before it needs replacing.One minor complaint: the medium sized cover is about two inches too tall for my Weber Silver B.  This means the bottom of the cover is on the ground.  Once you cinch it up, you don't notice this, but it does mean you have to remove the cover before you can push the grill (I move my grill away from the house before I use it).  Other than the height, this cover is a good fit on the Weber Silver B (which is about the same size as the Weber Spirit 200/300 grills). TL;DR:
generated: High quality grill cover for the good folks!

review9.reviewText: What a great product.  We have had numerous grill covers over the years.  The last one was made by the grill company specifically for their grill.  Well, let's just say it didn't hold up to the elements.This product is heavy.  Made with quality.  It has vents so the air within can escape.  To my great surprise it also has a zippered pocket for storing things.  A few tools perhaps, a recipe/instruction book.  I am not sure I will use that, but it is nice to have just in case.It covers the grill quite well.  In my case it hangs past the grill bottom onto the floor.  The strap ties don't help in bunching it up.  But I would rather have it overhang a bit than be too short.Looks good and so far has done the job of protecting my grill. TL;DR:

review10.reviewText: I am so happy with the quality of this product.  It was a great size, and is that heavy cover canvas type material.  This should easily last two or more years. TL;DR:
review10.summary: Very happy with the quality of this product

review11.reviewText: I've gone through three grill covers in the past 5-6 years as they simply cannot stand up to the brutal Arizona sun after 1-2 years.  Will this Classic Accessories cover hold up?  Too early to tell...but I like what I see thus far.The material is thick and water resistant.  The double stitching has no stray threads and looks rugged.  The cover has features that one expects in a cover: vents, zipped pockets, handles, and fasteners to tighten the grill in case of strong winds.  Even though we've come to expect such features, Classic Accessories executes well by making these features ergonomic and with excellent quality.Backed by a three year warranty and a four year limited warranty.  Price is fair for the quality of the product.  You go any cheaper, and you'll likely regret it with some unexpected rust.  Watch the video from the manufacture (on the left under the images) to see this product in action. TL;DR:
generated: The quality of the material and workmanship is superb

review12.reviewText: This cover is of very good quality and we're impressed with how well it's made.  It's heavy and sturdy and it feels and looks like it will last for a long time.We have a stainless steel 5-burner gas grill with the following dimensions - 64 by 21 by 37-1/2 inches.  We've had some problems locating a grill cover in the past that completely covered the bottom and we found it makes a big difference to how clean the grill stays.  We like a shiny and clean looking grill.  This fits very well on our grill and it goes all the way down to the ground. The cinch on the bottom of the cover is a great feature and works well.  It will also help to keep the grill clean from dust and rain.This cover looks very nice and overall we are very pleased. TL;DR:
generated: Nice Looking Positives - Much Better Construction Than The Poor Quality of the Cuts

review13.reviewText: This is a very nice grill cover and well made compared to others I've looked at. It's relatively heavy material. It even has a zippered pocket easily accesible at the top. The one thing you may run into is how are grills sized? This is described as a medium but is huge for our apparently little grill. But get the right size and it should be a great cover for years to come. TL;DR:
generated: Very nice looking looking grill, though it is a little big for our 4 burner model

review14.reviewText: I like this design- high back , front pull, leg straps and cinching base around the legs. Let the winds and rains blow, this puppy is staying in place.Pricing is a wee expensive per chair. So you'll want to take care of the cover. It's not a Sunbrella like fabric so I don't believe it will last 4 years looking good in the desert sun. I wonder if the manufacturer's replacement warranty covers looks. Don't think so? Neither do I. I like the taupe color which is more reflective. But I don't see myself buying covers for each of my outdoor furniture pieces. So the cost makes this impractical for me. TL;DR:
generated: Comfortable chair but not attractive enough for a home

review15.reviewText: I've learned the hard/expensive way that outdoor furniture covers are very much one of those "you get what you pay for" investments.  As I watched an inexpensive one fly away in our first serious windstorm one year, I realized that better ones have a way to fasten them securely onto the furniture.  Wrestling a giant tarp over my wicker love seat and coffee table one year made me long for handles and shaping of some kind.  Fabric needs to be sturdy and resistant to rain, sun, snow, and ice in my climate.The Ravenna cover meets all, and exceeds many, of, these requirements.  The fabric is a heavyweight, stitched, weatherized canvas that is warranted for four years.  The covers have handles (humorously, the instructions for use include, "If your cover has handles, use them to help pull the cover over your item" as if we might not think of that).  The fasteners include adjustable click-close straps that fasten around the furniture legs and stretch cording with toggles to pull it snug.  The covers are also vented to prevent captured air from lofting them skyward.I have a set of really heavy, wood and wrought iron chairs on my porch.  Last year, I loaned one to my mother and ended up leaving the rest out all winter to avoid lugging them to my garage, reasoning that the porch roof would protect them.  When I got back the one my mom had, which she had covered for the winter, the comparison made me realize what a disservice I'd done to my chairs.  These good-looking Ravenna covers will let me leave them on the porch without their being an eyesore, and also prevent my having to repaint them again. TL;DR:

review16.reviewText: After years of using various outdoor covers for furniture, grills and ATVs, I was shocked when I saw the quality of these covers. I was expecting the typical reinforced vinyl material that usually lasts two seasons max.  These Classic Accessories covers are constructed of a double stitched, woven polyester material like travel and duffle bags are made of plus they have a waterproof backing.  My first comment was, "These are too nice to leave outside on the deck all winter."Climate extremes are drastic from the scorching desert Southwest to the mildewing tropics of the Southeast which might be more harsh on the fabric than the winters in the upper Midwest.  Some regions might get longer service life than others thus 3-stars in one region and 5-stars in another.Some reviewers say their glass is half empty while others say it is half full.I've rated many items 1-Star.  When I do, I explain why in detail and how I believe it could be made better.  Quite often, I offer, IMHO, a better alternative.For the most part, the 4-Year Replacement Warranty on the Ravenna line speaks for itself.  Unless a family of raccoons finds a new home, I suspect they will last that long or longer.In addition to durability, quality amenities like easy to use buckles and tie-down straps provide a finished, tailored and stylish appearance.If you have quality outdoor furniture with no place to store it during the winter months, here's your answer.Here we go.There are more durable options that will last longer. I have several Military Specification, industrial grade, 22 oz. treated canvas tarps that have lasted over a dozen years.  They are bulky and hard to fold. For 4 months out of the year, the general appearance is that an army of Hobbits have set up an encampment on my deck while the NSA satellite monitors believe that I'm hiding something lethal.Well, I guess a couple of large BBQ grills could be deadly, especially the way I cook.The problem with this option is that whatever you have covered in these tarps will smell like an Army tent for a month after the covers are removed. TL;DR:
review16.summary: UNDER COVER HAS NEVER LOOKED BETTER.
generated: Solidly constructed and designed, excellent build quality

review17.reviewText: Wow.  My first impression of these chair covers was just that.  Wow.  I could not believe the quality of the material they used to make these covers.  I have seen and used ones in the past that barely made it one winter,  These ones are impressive and I have high hopes they will last a while and with a 4 yr guarantee I doubt I will be disappointed.I stacked 4 chairs and the legs do stick out but the majority of the chair is covered.  I will buy more so I do not have to stack as high.I also liked the straps that wrapped around the legs of the chairs so that the covers do not blow off. TL;DR:

review18.reviewText: I had not been taking care of a set of outdoor chairs that a friend had made for us. After I scrubbed and refinished I knew that I had to get something to protect them during out long, wet winters.These Ravenna products are just what the chair doctor ordered! They are very well constructed, and what impresses the most is how well they fit, and how secure they are.We get high winds and the straps that secure around the chair legs are adjustable and generous in size to fit just about any width of a chair leg. These covers will most definitely not blow away in the wind! They are so well fitted , with a pull tie to really secure them on the chair, that they will also protect my chairs from the elements and winter weather very well. I have become a real fan of this brand of cover now, and I will be purchasing more! The material is good looking and feels sturdy and very secure and water proof.Excellent quality, wonderful construction and a modest cost - what's not to love! Try them - I think you too will appreciate them! TL;DR:

review19.reviewText: Last winter my fire pit suffered greatly at the hands of 4 feet of snow which unexpectedly fell in our area. Even though I turned it upside down, the water still gathered and I struggled with rust.So I was grateful to have this beautiful (can you call a cover that?) cover. I thought it would just be cheap plastic, but it isn't - it is a heavy canvas type material. My fire pit is on the small side, so this fit all the way to the bottom covering it up. I only wish it had instructions in the package so that I could take advantage of all of the features without coming here to Amazon and looking at the photos.Very, very well built, and designed not to tear after a single season like cheap plastic ones, plus it ties down in a way that keeps it from being blown off by the wind.Five stars. TL;DR:
review19.summary: Small was plenty big for my fire pit ...

review20.reviewText: This is a very well made cover made for round fire pits of up to 5 feet in diameter. It's a greyish taupe color (more grey) and has a textured tough outside with a smoother inside for water resistence. I like that it can be cinched up and also has snaps to hold the cover on the pit. As far as quality goes, this is one of the best outdoor covers I've owned. Pricewise it is also one of the more expensive ones. Worth it if the fabric holds up. TL;DR:
generated: Best Cover In The World For An Outdoor Pit

review21.reviewText: I got this cover to protect a small firepit I have in the yard.  The firepit has four metal legs, the body is 36" in diameter, with a mesh metal cover.  The cover had a height of about 10" over the top rim of the firebowl.The construction of this cover is very nice.  It is a heavy material and a soft taupe color, natural enough to blend in with most backgrounds.  It feels nice and thick, and is not flimsy by any standard.It is advertised as fitting up to a 44" firepit.  Again, I got it for a 36" firepit.Putting the cover on is simple.  It has two straps which buckle around two legs of the pit on opposing sides.  It also has two elastic hem cords, which allow you to tighten the cover to fit snugly around the underside of your firebowl.  You can wrap the two opposing hem cords around a leg each (I think some of the manufacturer ads even show this), so you can secure the cover to all four legs.  While I do not think it is going anywhere, I would have preferred four buckles so that all four sides by the firepit legs could be secured.  I realize not all firepits are the same size and may have different leg configurations, so maybe that was not practical from a design standpoint.There are also handles on either side of the cover so you can lift the firepit and move it.  The material handles are heavy duty and double-stiched in so they shouldn't be an issue.For anyone who likes to keep some wood in your firepit, or just avoid rain washing ashes all over your patio, etc. this is a great cover.It adjusts easily, fits my firepit perfectly and is a nice solution.  We recently had two heavy rainstorms by me, and some wind, and the cover repelled water nicely, was dry afterward, and most importantly, kept the firepit bone dry. TL;DR:

review22.reviewText: This is an excellent fire pit cover. The material is durable and it seems that it will withstand the elements (we live in the country). It tightens with a drawstring and has nylon handles to help move the covered pit. The color is neutral and the overall quality is what you would expect. I feel the price is very moderate for a quality cover. TL;DR:

review23.reviewText: The Ravenna fire pit cover is made of substantial material which looks like treated canvas or cordura.  It has a water[proof pvc backing, drawstring closure and handle to make handling it easier.  The finish levels very high, with no loose seams or threads. It is about as nicely made a cover as I have seen.  I suspect that had we been able to find something like this for our barbeque it would have lasted a lot longer than it did.  Sure to extend the useful life of  your fire pit. (maybe I should look tosee if they have something which would fit our barbeque!) as covers go, this is well done. TL;DR:

review24.reviewText: I got theCobraCo FB6102 Round Cast Iron Brick Finish Fire Pit with Screen and Covera few months back and have liked it. That fire pit came with its own plastic cover that fits it perfectly. The problem is, it is absolutely useless if you want to keep water out of the fire pit. Water just seeps right through it as if it were a sieve.I found a pool of standing water in the pit about a month ago where mosquitoes were breeding. Nice. Not only that, but the screen that fits over the pit has now started to rust because of the water problem.I resolved to get a better cover for the fire pit. Having had a very good experience with theClassic Accessories 55-142-055101-EC Ravenna Grill Cover, X-Large, Tauperecently, I looked for a fire pit cover from the same company and found the Classic Accessories Ravenna Round Fire Pit Cover, Taupe.This cover did the trick. Not only does it look nice, but it is obviously more durable than the cover that came with the pit. Drawstring closures on both sides let you adjust the fit for your pit and keep the cover from blowing off. It also has clasps that you can put around the legs of your pit to hold the cover in place. Handles on top of the cover make it easy to lift the cover off.We've had some good thunderstorms since I got this cover and the pit has stayed dry through all of them.I'm very happy with this cover and with the Classic Accessories brand in general. I will look at their product line again should I have need for something else they make in the future. TL;DR:
review24.summary: Fire pit cover fits well, is very durable and keeps my pit dry
generated: Great cover, very useful for the weather, great for pit maintenance.

review25.reviewText: My fire pit came with a cover that resembled a giant black shower cap. After seeing this one, I decided to give it a try and see if it worked any better than the included cover. I will say that this cover is definitely better looking that the cover that came with the pit. The cover appears to be very durable. Even with all the straps and cords on this cover I could not get it to fit well enough on my fire fit to begin using this one over the cover included with my fire pit. If you need a cover for your fire pit, this one is very nice quality but you may not have any luck getting it to fit. TL;DR:
review25.summary: Did not fit my smaller fire pit well

review26.reviewText: This canvas is a very sturdy canvas material.  It completely covers my fire pit.  Even though I've cinched it up it was still too big to stay on the firepit. We've since put on the BBQ grill and it works great for that too. Very sturdy, I would easily recommend. TL;DR:
review26.summary: Sturdy canvas; use as a grill cover too.

review27.reviewText: When we got our 44-inch diameter Cobraco fire pit, we were excited.  The fire pit was pretty, and we liked the weight of the fire pit, which was heavier than our previous fire pit, which tended to blow around in moderate winds.  However, we were unhappy with the cover that came with the fire pit, which was lightweight plastic with multiple seams that permitted water to leak into the fire pit bowl.  We knew we had to replace the cheap cover with something much more substantial, and the small Ravenna round fire pit cover, which is intended for fire pits up to 44 inches in diameter, appeared to be perfect.When we received the fire pit cover, I was a little concerned about whether the cover was large enough for our fire pit, and I wondered how it attached to our fire pit.  I was needlessly concerned.  The cover has hem cords or straps that tighten the fire pit cover periphery to make it fit snugly onto a fire pit, along with two straps that we used to attach the fire pit cover onto the legs of our fire pit.  Attaching the cover to our fire pit was a matter of two or three minutes of effort to achieve a secure fit.  We quickly learned that the small fire pit cover is intended to cover only the fire pit bowl and the fire pit legs remain slightly uncovered.  Since the legs on our fire pit appear to have a heavy coat of paint, exposure of the legs was fine.  Plus, the exposed legs seem, to us, to be attractive.We are very pleased that the taupe color of the fire pit matches our deck and items on our deck nicely (yes, our deck is wood, but we have bricks that protect our deck from the fire pit).  While black does match most things on our deck, the taupe is an even better match.Does the fire pit cover keep water out of the fire pit bowl?  Yes, it does.  Indeed, the cover has a lining that appears to be water-resistant.  The material of the cover seems to be a heavy canvas-like material that seems as though it would be quite durable, which it must be because the manufacturer offers a four year replacement warranty for the fire pit cover.We needed a fire pit cover to replace the cheap piece of plastic provided by the fire pit manufacturer.  We held our expectations for the Ravenna fire pit cover low, but were extremely pleased with the quality, functionality, and style of the small round Ravenna fire pit cover.  If you are looking for a small round fire pit cover, this one seems to have all the features you would need.Enjoy! TL;DR:

review28.reviewText: This cover has held up well to more than a few torrential downpours over the past several weeks.  Even in some pretty high wind conditions, I've not had to worry about the cover blowing off or the fire pit getting wet.My husband placed our fire pit on top of a pretty substantial tree stump and built a rock wall around it to make it appear more permanent. It looks amazing, but I worried that we'd have to be replacing fire pits every year since I couldn't cover it because of the rocks.  The size of this cover allows me to cover pretty much the whole thing. Now the only thing I worry about is the spiders and chipmunks that live under there to keep dry.We'll probably keep this cover on all winter, but will likely cover everything with black tarp to keep the cover cleaner. TL;DR:
generated: Not good with the black tarp...

review29.reviewText: We have a beautiful copper fire pit.  The cover that came with it is flimsy and we are now on our third cover.  We've only had it about a year, and I wouldn't even say normal wear and tear as we do not use it that often-the cover we received with the pit just doesn't hold up.And so I was happy to get this cover.  It's durable and made of (seemingly) strong material.  To tighten it up there are two adjustable bungee cords, and two buckles.I will say that ours is brown, as opposed to the black you see in the picture, but that is of no concern to us.It is more or less a one size fits all-you either get large or small, and you adjust it to fit your fire pit.  The small doesn't fit ours as securely as the cover that we received with our fire pit, but this one is of much better quality.Thirty dollars well spent! TL;DR:

review30.reviewText: This is my second Ravenna cover (I also have one for my patio loveseat); they are absolutely the best covers I've ever seen, and here in the Northeast I need good covers -- especially since I don't have the space to bring my furniture in in inclement weather.THE GREAT:+ Roomy... easy on and easy off+ Rubbery waterproof material inside, sturdy canvas outside+ Thick double stitching indicates durability+ Air vents to prevent mildew+ Gathered elastic 'belt' on the bottom (and buckles!) so it won't blow off (like our grill cover incessantly does).  This is also helpful as my chaise lounge is not as long as the cover - the belt makes the cover still fit snugly.So far, works great and has remained waterproof through several rainstorms.  I haven't had it in snow yet of course, but I will update.BOTTOM LINE:  Durable, strong, weather-resistant.  Very high quality. TL;DR:

review31.reviewText: The most impressive -and wholly unforeseen - factor that impressed me about this chaise cover was its ability to withstand a moderate hailstorm without getting any rips or tears. The hail, which started when we were outside, was somewhere between pea-sized and slightly larger. It was large enough to be painful and left some welts. But the chaise cover came through just fine. I can't say that about others we've had - this is our third so far, all from different manufacturers. None lasted more than a season.I'll update this review after we have a season of severe weather, snow, ice, etc. But based on results so far, I'm very hopeful this will do well.There are some features I especially like about this cover:It is easy to use and can fit a range of chaise lengths. Ours is shorter than the suggested maximum of 66" and at first we thought the cover would be too baggy. But the hem cord is adjustable, easily allowing us to get a snug fit. Also there are click and snap belts for each leg. No trouble getting those in place. The ideal chaise for this cover would probably be a bit longer. But even on our smaller chaise, this works fine.All in all, it took less than 5 minutes to get this set in place and then adjusted on our chaise and some of that was time removing the cover from the box and packaging. The fabric is nice and thick and, as noted above, didn't rip or tear during a hailstorm, one in which even a couple of roof shingles fell off (and yes, we maintain our roof). In short, this isn't some thin plastic like the type you'd find on inferior covers. It is meant to protect outdoor furniture -and so far it does that very, very well.Since the hailstorm, there have also been quite a few of those sudden and intense summer storms, complete with high winds and drenching rain. Any stains or residue from sticks, dirt, or leaves which fell on the chaise cover were easily wiped up.The padded handles are a very nice touch, making the cover easy to grip and move, both while on the chaise and when getting ready to store it. TL;DR:
review31.summary: No holes during a moderate hailstorm! Also, easy to use and superior in many ways to others

review32.reviewText: I had been looking for a cover for my xl anti gravity chair. I decided that a chase lounge cover would probably be about right. I could not be more pleased. It did not come with instructions but I knew I was gonna do my own thing anyway. The quality is excellent except for the part that has the drawstring cord that casing is  a bit thin but it has a 4 yr warranty so I'm not going to worry about it. It has 4 snaping buckles like luggage straps 2 on each end I folded the fabric inverted and hooked these together on both ends and pulled the drawstring a bit. My chair is perfectly covered I can have it lay out or sit up. The chair is heavy and I was tired of lugging it in each time it rains. Now I don't have to worry about bird dropping either.If you want an attractive and durable cover for an anti gravity or chase this fills the bill. I do recommend this item everything I saw at local stores felt like those dollar store picnic table covers not this one. TL;DR:
review32.summary: Works exactly as I had hoped. Using on XL anti gravity chair.
generated: Very high quality - I was so happy I purchased it

review33.reviewText: The cover is made of woven polyester with a laminated polyvinyl chloride backing, and is large enough to fit a piece up to 66 inches in length, 28 inches in width and 27 and a half inches in height. The taupe color is more of a medium brown in hue, and neutral enough to go with any outdoor decor. There is quality evident throughout from the skillful top-stitching, to the click-close straps that attach to the legs to secure the cover in place. This is a very handsome way to protect patio furniture.Included is a brief, but clearly detailed instruction sheet which also includes a care guide. To prevent the protective coating from being removed, the cover should not be cleaned with soap or bleach - just use a soft brush and lukewarm water. Line dry, no iron, and it should not be put away wet to avoid possible mildew. The fabric is not fire resistant so keep it away from hot grills and fire pits.The fabric is reminiscent of a quality back-pack - nothing like the thin weight covers I've owned in the past which were more like a vinyl tablecloth or heavy drop cloth. Beautiful cover. TL;DR:

review34.reviewText: The first thing is to make sure you order the correct cover for the style of chaise you have.  This cover is for a "standard" chaise and the company also makes a Patio Day Chaise cover.  There is an illustration toward the bottom of the product description to show which type is which.  I have the Strathwood Rhodes Chaise Lounge Chair and the cover fits perfectly.  It fits (fairly snuggly) with the cushions still on the chair, but I'm afraid that critters would decide it makes a good place to hunker down over the long Minnesota winter.  When I take the cushions off, the cover reaches further down the legs of my chaise.  However, looking at the photo, I think you are meant to leave the cushions on -- which is probably a good idea if you live somewhere less wintry that Minnesota.The fabric looks really durable and has a waterproof backing.  The seams look secure and solidly made and the cover buckles around the chair legs for a secure fit.  I think this is a really well made chaise cover.So why is it only "almost" perfect for me?  My patio will be deep in snow this winter -- the Farmers' Almanac is predicting a snowy one -- and I'm afraid the legs of my chaise will get damaged by not being covered all the way to the ground.But unless you have feet of snow for several months in your winter forecast, this chaise cover is probably perfect for you -- as long as you make sure to get the right one for your style of chaise! TL;DR:
review34.summary: Almost perfect...but could be perfect for your climate
generated: Perfect for me -- and is a good thing for the environment ...

review35.reviewText: One of my outside cats thinks the chaise lounge was put on the deck just for him! Hootie spends a great deal of time lounging!It isn't that Hootie is a dirty cat but he does shed and his paws get wet/dirty. Also when it does rain it takes  several days for the chaise cushion to dry out ( I am not always at home to put the cushions in the garage)The fabric is super tough.  I can just hose it off ater Hootie moves his royl tush.It was easy to install and the directions were easy to read/understand.We get some really fierce storms here in eastern NC this cover stayed on through 58 MPH winds during our last  t -Storm.It looks nice  and does what it is suppose to do !It protects the chaise loubge really well. A little pricey buit if it lasts several years it is worth it. I would recommend. TL;DR:

review36.reviewText: Every year as I wrestle a blue tarp over my wicker loveseat and try to angle the rest of my winter storage items to sit on it so it will stay put, I long for an actual furniture cover.  The Ravenna is an excellent choice.  It is heavy, yet easily maneuverable with its padded handles.  The fasteners are secure but very easy to use to make sure the cover isn't blown off and doesn't shift to expose part of the loveseat.  It's roomy enough to allow me to stack the loveseat and chair cushions under it.This is far from the least expensive furniture cover I've seen (in my longing, I've looked at a LOT of them); in fact, it's one of the more expensive ones.  It has more features than I've seen on even the most expensive, though, and I anticipate years of good service from it.  For now, the blue tarp will have to suffice for the rest of my patio furniture, but I hope to get Ravenna covers for everything before next winter. TL;DR:
generated: Cute for a short, awkward, yet well-balanced person...

review37.reviewText: I realize that a patio furniture cover is not the sexiest home item out there, and probably a lot of people wouldn't get this excited about theirs.  But this is the best cover I've ever seen, and here in the Northeast I need good covers -- especially since I don't have the space to bring my furniture in in inclement weather.THE GREAT:+ Roomy... easy on and easy off+ Rubbery waterproof material inside, sturdy canvas outside+ Thick double stitching indicates durability+ Air vents to prevent mildew+ Gathered elastic 'belt' on the bottom (and buckles!) so it won't blow off (like our grill cover incessantly does)So far, works great and has remained waterproof through several rainstorms.  I haven't had it in snow yet of course, but I will update.BOTTOM LINE:  Durable, strong, weather-resistant.  Very high quality. TL;DR:

review38.reviewText: I was impressed with the weight, quality, features, and appearance of this Loveseat cover.  It is a very heavy material.  The stitching is durable and well finished.  The ties which hold the cover to each of my four loveseat legs are sturdy plastic slips and there is an adjustable elastic band, more like a long bungee cord, sewn all the way around the bottom.  Once attached this cover isn't blowing away unless the sofa it's covering goes with it.But here's that secret I was talking about.  Our patio furniture consists of a 2-3 person loveseat and two chairs.  That's a total of four bottom cushions and four back cushions.  If this cover was at all decent, and it exceeds decent by a long shot, I planned on getting a pair of covers for our chairs.  What I discovered, though, was that this is large enough so I can put all the cushions on the loveseat and still cover everything securely and completely.My advice is that you will not be disappointed with this cover.  I've had other covers in the past that were slightly less expensive and nowhere near as good.  And, if you think you might need covers for chairs with cushions as well get this first and maybe it will be all you'll need too. TL;DR:
review38.summary: A great cover PLUS the dirty little secret they don't want you to know

review39.reviewText: I was impressed with the reinforced seams and (apparently) durable material, along with the various clips to attach it so that it wouldn't blow off during wind.  I can't say how long the materials will last, but it looks like it is very well made. TL;DR:

review40.reviewText: This is one of the best choices I have made for my back porch. This cover is great, it is extremely durable and fits perfect over our love seat sized outdoor chairs. This cover not only keeps the weather and other elements off the furniture, it keeps the pets off also. We have been searching for the right cover for a while, one that would provide durability and not compromise the looks of our porch. This cover is easy to place on and remove from the furniture, it folds up much like a small blanket which makes for easy storage when not in use. Highly recommend this cover for anyone that has outdoor furniture that is being destroyed by the weather or pets that like to sleep on the furniture. TL;DR:

review41.reviewText: The taupe color is more of a medium brown in hue. The cover is made of woven polyester with a laminated polyvinyl chloride backing. There is quality evident throughout the piece from the careful top-stitching to the click-close straps that attach to the legs helping secure the cover in place. This is a very handsome way to protect patio furniture from the weather.Included is a brief, but clearly detailed instruction sheet which also includes a care guide. To prevent the protective coating from being removed, the cover should not be cleaned with soap or bleach - just use a soft brush and lukewarm water. Line dry, no iron, and it should not be put away wet to avoid possible mildew. The fabric is not fire resistant so keep it away from hot grills and fire pits.The fabric is reminiscent of a quality back-pack - nothing like the covers I've owned in the past which were more like a vinyl tablecloth or heavy drop cloth. I expect to get years of use from this product. TL;DR:
generated: An excellent way to protect my front porch furniture

review42.reviewText: This cover is tough, looks nice, and I'm thrilled I bought it.  Rather than having the rain pound away at my outdoor furniture, I will be buying more of these for my single wicker chair and ottoman for use next year.  It has been really nice not to have to take the cushions off the loveseat, and instead easily put the cover on it and not have to worry about sitting on a sponge-wet cushion.The cover has seen plenty of time in the sun and rain this summer on my deck, and it looks good as new.  The cover also goes down low enough where hornets don't seem to want to build their nests inside it; I've had just such a problem with the gazebo coverings and curtains on the deck, and the last thing I wanted to do was take a cover like this off and find a nest staring me in the face with angry hornets.  No such problems have arisen with this cover.  But we do remove it and put it back on frequently; perhaps that helps.All in all, after about two months of summer, I am completely happy with this cover and definitely recommend it. TL;DR:
review42.summary: Fits perfectly, easy to handle, taking a beating in the sun and still looks nice
generated: Excellent product and a great cover!

review43.reviewText: This Ravenna Loveseat Cover is amazing! It fit my Martha Stewart Patio Loveseat perfectly even though I got the smaller size. It fits loveseats 58"L x 35.5" W x 31" H. The cover is made of very high quality and thick material; the outer material is a thick canvas and the underside is "waterproof" plastic. It has handles for easily removing the cover and I love that it has 4 buckles around the bottom of the cover so that you can secure the cover to the loveseat. This is especially helpful because it can get quite windy where I live when it storms. It also has a tether cord you can tighten for extra security. There's also a "mildew window" that allows air to circulate under the cover so if it's wet, mildew won't form. We use our cover on our deck where it's out in the open and when the cover gets wet from rain, it dries pretty quickly.The only downside I've found to this cover is that although it says it's waterproof, my loveseat cushions still get slightly wet underneath the cover after it rains. Therefore, it's not as waterproof as I'd like it to be. But this is definitely the best cover I have owned and is definitely worth the price! TL;DR:
generated: Best cover on the market for the quality and price.

review44.reviewText: I have an outdoor foosball table that needs both rain/sun covering during the months we are outdoors and heavier protection during the winter.  I have tried various tarps and other covers, but none have fit very well. This is a perfect fit.  It is designed with a higher back, but on my table the top is flat and the extra fabric on that side is filled with the foosball table rods. The longer side (back) reaches a couple of inches above the ground.  I put the shorter side on the back where the wind and rain don't hit it.  It looks like it is made for covering the table, not the sloppy, shoddy look of tarps.  It is easy even for kids to remove and reinstall.The cover itself is very sturdy and well made.  I need to cover some other items that don't fit well under standard covers, like a new potting bench I got that recommends winter covering. I will order the large cover for that.I am very impressed with this cover and look forward to many years of use. TL;DR:
review44.summary: Perfect fit for my outdoor foosball table

review45.reviewText: Yes, I ordered this to cover a love seat, but I forgot to measure and it is a little small for that.  It is, however a perfect fit for my barbecue.  This cover is well made and seems to keep rain out very well.  I was impressed with the fabric, backing, and the stitching, even though the stitches are quite large.  To keep it from blowing off, there are draw strings that pull the bottom of the cover together, making it very difficult for the wind to lift it off of the barbeque or loveseat. TL;DR:
generated: Perfect fit for my Weber Genesis Silver B charcoal grill

review46.reviewText: The material that makes up this cover just feels amazing.  High quality, luxurious, rugged material on the outside with a shiny waterproof liner on the inside.  The stitching is first rate.  There are nice pulls to snug the bottom of the cover.  Convenient strong fabric handles are very useful to position this on the couch.The only con is that there is no bag or case to store this in.  The cover itself is so top rate though, this still gets a 5 star rating. TL;DR:

review47.reviewText: This is a beautifully made, high quality item. The fabric has a plastic, water-proof backing, and the seam construction is amazing. I have no doubt that it will protect outdoor furniture during harsh weather.From my perspective, there is a downside, although it may be an upside from your own perspective: This cover is very fitted and it does not work perfectly with my wicker. Let me explain.Before ordering, I quickly measured my outdoor furniture, which I had purchased here at Amazon. My loveseat was just a couple inches shorter than the length and width of the marked dimensions. That did not seem like alot, so I ordered it. However, after putting it on, I can tell you it is alot. Of course the cover actually covers the loveseat, however it doesn't look as pictured here. Instead, this beautiful, well-made item looks haphazard and misshapen. It's really not.So, my caution is ... make sure to get the cover that actually fits properly & snugly. I bet that this cover matches a standard brand or form, but I don't know what that is. However, I do know that this item is not a good fit on the wicker that I purchased here. A couple inches here and a couple inches there make a big difference. TL;DR:
review47.summary: Quality Item - Read on for best fit.

review48.reviewText: We have half a dozen of these Classic Accessories outdoor furniture covers and have been using them for the past 2-3 years, year-round, for the most part. They work fairly well. They keep the furniture dry and protected and can be easily secured to the legs with click latches that keep them blowing off in storms. I will note that though the item pictured is black, all of our covers, including the one received from ordering via this page, are actually tan. So, just be aware.These seem fairly well-made, sturdy and have handles to take on and off more easily. My only gripe is that they're not indestructible which, of course, is probably hoping for too much. We've noted that 3 years is about their max life span, with cracks or tears occurring after that even with careful care. I think it's just exposure to the weather (where we live it gets very hot) and is basically inevitable. I blame the sun as much as the winter weather, because those covers that are left mostly on during the summer months, for outdoor furniture not used as often that is totally exposed, the life expectancy of the covers is about a season. Those under a little more protection, where the cover is mostly used only during winter months, have lasted up to three years. Your mileage may vary, but that's been our experience.Still, despite the somewhat limited life, I haven't found better covers than the Classic brand in this price range. TL;DR:
generated: Excellent, but not every cover is as good as everyone else

review49.reviewText: I have a painted wood bench made up of thin wood slats. It is 70" long and 28" wide -a bit smaller than this cover. It sits out on our patio and is too big to put in the shed for the winter. We just repainted it and thought this cover would be perfect to protect it. The cover fits on very nicely and with the click-close straps it tightens up enough that it seems as if it will be protected in the winter and not blow off, yet it is loose enough that the bench is still available to put things on if we are bringing them in the back of the house.The construction is very good, with wide seams and sturdy closings. The fabric itself is strong, but yet soft enough that it will not become stiff. I can say this because we have another cover made by this company that we have used for 3 years on our chaise lounge. That cover is still in good shape. It has lasted through blizzards and ice storms, up on a deck where it is more exposed to the winds and weather.So I expect the same reliability out of this cover, since it seems to be made in the same durable manner. TL;DR:
generated: A Better Cover with Strong Colors

review50.reviewText: This chair cover far surpasses covers that I spent the same amount of money on at a local big box superstore. This one has elastic to fit the bottom around the chair, with pull strings to tighten it down. It also has clips and straps to secure it to the chair. In comparison, the big box competitor version had cheap flimsy ties that broke quickly, and so loose they flapped around. In contrast, this one is great!This fits on my swivel wicker chair with a pile of cushions and pillows stuffed underneath for protection. It is made of a sturdy canvas that is contoured to fit the chair. It's waterproof with moisture beading up and rolling off.The best part of this cover is that it can be fitted so well that the cover does not blow off in the wind or flap around. The straps and elastic bands make it possible to fit it to several different chair shapes in the same size range. It also has a convenient handle on the front for lifting it up to remove it.The color is described as taupe. It's fairly dark, a brownish/olive color. Yeah, I guess that would be taupe. It's pretty true to the color in the photo.Now that I have reviewed this one, I want to purchase another one to put on my other chair! TL;DR:

review51.reviewText: These covers are made of a very high quality of material.  I have seen and used ones in the past that barely made it one year (Pennsylvania) These ones are impressive and I have high hopes they will last a while and with a 4 yr guarantee I doubt I will be disappointed.I also liked the straps that wrapped around the legs of the chairs so that the covers do not blow off. TL;DR:

review52.reviewText: This chair cover keeps your chair ready to use whether it is keeping it clean or simply dry.  There is always a bird flying over, rain, or just dirt etc. blowing in the wind so I appreciate the convenience of keeping it covered until I wish to sit down.The cover fits great and is easy to use.  I feel it is durable and will last a good amount of time. TL;DR:
review52.summary: Keeps the chair ready for use
generated: Great cover for our little bird feeder

review53.reviewText: This is not your average chair cover that you usually see in big box or department stores. This is very substantial and well-made and the details give it a very classy look and make it look a lot more expensive than it actually is. The neutral taupe color will go in any environment, no matter what color your house or deck is. The seams are double stitched and look very durable.  There are four custom-colored buckles that you can tighten to keep the cover secure during any weather and make it easy to put on or take off. I really like the structured air vents that should prevent a good wind from coming along and lifting under the cover during winter storms. It should also let the cover "breathe" so mold or mildew doesn't form during our rainy winters here in California.  Also much appreciated are the sturdy padded handles that are a big help when putting the cover on or removing it. (Or just carrying it around.)I ordered this cover to use on a chair which is water and weather proof and can stay out all year, but the chair is white and  we have a lot of small oak leaves and other blowing debris that seem to come down all year, even during the winter. They tend to leave stains that are hard to remove without a lot of elbow grease, especially on white furniture, if they sit on it for any length of time when the weather is wet. Having the chair covered will mean much less clean-up come spring.This cover comes with a 4 year warranty and it certainly looks and feels sturdy enough that it should last long beyond that amount of time. TL;DR:
generated: Handy, solid cover for a moderate-sized-size chair.

review54.reviewText: Very nice chair cover.  Really.  We like it a lot.  From the Dad perspective, it's a solid canvas cover that goes over the chair, and that's all that's needed.  But more importantly, Queen Bee likes it a lot, and that is your target demographic, Classic Accessories.  The only real problem I see is that at close to $50 a pop, while we can afford to put one of these on the other three Adirondacks on the deck to match--and this is very important with the target demographic--the need to get another four each in two separate styles and the matching table cover, and then the matching grill cover is going to be pretty spendy, mighty close to prohibitively spendy.  Nice, sure, but looking at more than $500 for this lovely matching transition has even the Queen Bee admitting it's a bit much.We like the color.  The original canvas covers, which it just so happens are now falling apart, are the traditional oatmeal/sand color, which is nice enough new, but after a summer or two outdoors turns an unattractive bleached-out kinda-white.  And, we notice that the lighter color really highlights the green mold growing on all of the covers.  So, this darker color--the highly evocative and official "dark taupe/mushroom/espresso"--is so far a winner.  Time will tell how the inevitable weathering will work for this product.The weatherproofing is good, and it's shed water perfectly for the past month.  The fit over the chair has not led to any pooling, which is always a plus.It's got a handle in the front and back, and a vent in the back, but the old cover has the same.  I'm not seeing anything special about these essentially standard features.  This cover has a dash of color variation in the 1" nylon webbing of the handle.  The product copy says "webbed handles with extra padding," but I'm not seeing the padding.  Nylon webbing makes up the two handles, and there is a tiny bit of softness behind the handle which may legally qualify as padding, but touting it as "extra padding" is disingenuous at best.  But then again, who needs padding to use a nylon web handle on a chair cover?  Honestly.The "structured vent" is not bad; some tightened-up sewing and a couple of creases do keep it slightly open.  But the vent's mesh screen, while sounding impressive, is utterly superfluous, given that the entire bottom of the cover is completely open.This is a heavy-duty cover, and just putting it over the chair is an undertaking.  The wife likes the elastic drawstring around the bottom.  That's a good addition to keep it all snug over the chair.And to really make sure it doesn't go anywhere you've got the little buckled straps that go around the legs, the "belted channel attachment system," to keep it that much more secure.  This is a nice touch, sure, but it seems overkill.  If the wind is strong enough to lift this roughly four-pound cover off a full-size Adirondack chair, we've got a lot more to worry about than the covers staying on the chairs.  This observation aside, the Queen really loves this little feature; it's another little doo-dad to engage as part of the cover-the-stuff-on-the-deck ritual.Bottom line: this is very nice product outdoor-chair-covering technology.  We've got no complaints about any aspect of it.  But to get everything under the same covers is going to be an expensive endeavor.  This is a hit with the primary domestic team leader, so as other covers wear out, this cover has set a successful precedent for a likely wave of Classic Accessories replacements, the cost be damned! TL;DR:
generated: "All That So Far" looks like a fine home with the "incredibility of a cover," but for the modest buyer buying this will do nothing.  It's nice, and it's

review55.reviewText: This is a very nice solar only (no battery charging) fountain pump. Since it runs in direct sunshine it works nicely in my pond on hot summer days when I love giving my fish extra oxygen in the water (warm water holds less oxygen stressing the fish).It floats on top of the water and the amount of water that shoots up is based on the amount of sunshine, but it works nicely even in partial shade in my open back yard. Interestingly, at times (with less than full sunlight) it spits the water up every couple of seconds making an interesting and fun effect.I found that the open top worked best in my pond since I was looking for something a bit "bigger" than a birdbath size. I wanted "aeration" as well as a nice look.I am particularly grateful (as are my goldfish) that VicTsing offered a complimentary sample of the fountain pump so that I could test it and write a review of my experiences. I am very grateful to be able to report that it works even better than expected. TL;DR:
review55.summary: I am using this in my small goldfish pond
generated: Works Well for an Indispensable Purpose

review56.reviewText: This little fountain was perfect for using in my mother's birdbath. She has a ton of birds she feeds with various bird feeders, and a large concrete birdbath placed right in the center of them all. After trying out the different included nozzles, we found the bubbler one to be the best, since the other ones worked so well, they would shoot the water out of the birdbath! Those nozzles are perfect for ponds, since they are larger than the typical birdbath.The birds enjoys the activity of the bubbling water, and since it's solar powered, there's no messing with running lines anywhere. It's so simple to set up, more so than we expected. It does need bright direct sunlight to work. It doesn't bank sunlight power for later, like some solar walkway lights do. This just works during the day when the sun is out and bright. As soon as the sunlight isn't beating down on it, the amount of water it shoots goes way down, to little more than a tiny trickle.This is a GREAT little fountain since it's just so simple to use and set up and works so well. It's self contained. It works when the sun is the most intense, which the birds appreciate. Great for birdbaths and ponds, and extremely affordable. The VicTsing fountain exceeded my expectations!A sample was provided for reviewing purposes. TL;DR:
review56.summary: So simple to use and set up

review57.reviewText: The floating solar fountain pump is adorable. I put it in a bird bath with no problem. We are having a little issue with the pump wanting to stay on the bottom of the fountain. The solar panels don't store energy so the minute there is a shadow the water stops, as you can see when I pass my hand over the water.The fountain comes with various size tops so you have tall or shorter. We chose the one that kept the water coming back into the birdbath so it didn't all get sprayed out. The directions say not to let the pump get dry, it will damage it.I think this is super cute and a great addition to a back yard, either in a bird bath, you could put in a zen type garden with a little bowl, float it in a small pond with some water lilies, it's just a very adaptable little fountain- about the size of a dessert plate.sample provided TL;DR:

review58.reviewText: This product offers the ability to add aeration (as well as visual interest) to a birdbath without having to deal with any wires or extension cords. It's a pretty simple product - the base is a solar panel which powers a small pump underneath. It comes with a variety of spout attachments to vary the water spray pattern.However, the product design is not well-suited for birdbaths. The pump needs to be fully-submerged in water, which means the birdbath has to be at least 2 inches deep. The suction cups on the base of the pump are pretty weak and will not hold it in place. So, if the basin is shallow at the edges, the platform will float to areas where the pump will not work well. Plus, the pump should remain submerged at all times since pulling in air puts a strain on any water pump.It's much better suited for a pond where it can float freely and keep the pump fully-submerged at all times.Although the pump is pretty small, it does put out a surprising amount of spray. There are four spray patterns to select from. In full sunlight the spray height was easily a foot+ high. That's a bit too much for a birdbath, but nice for a pond. I ended up removing the spray attachments (they are plastic and just push on - no tools needed) so the water just "burbles" up from the center. That provides me with the aeration effect I was looking for. Not as pretty as a spray, but more effective for a birdbath.The build quality appears decent for the price. However, given the all-plastic construction, this is not something you'd want to leave outdoors in the winter.The solar panel provides ample power in full sunlight, and workable power in partial sun/overcast conditions (by "workable" I mean the spray works, but the height is diminished, and it occasionally will cut off for a few seconds). There is no battery, so if there's no sun, there's no spray.I can't speak to the longevity of the pump, but will update the review should there be a problem. It operates quietly, which is nice.It comes with a brief instruction sheet that is not well written, but the operation of the device is pretty straightforward so that you can figure it out just by looking at the pieces and parts (which are just the spray attachments and connectors).This is a great choice for a pond, and may be a workable choice for a birdbath depending on the depth. I'll give it 4.5 stars (rounded to 5 since it looks pretty!).[Sample provided for review] TL;DR:
review58.summary: Workable for birdbaths but better suited for ponds
generated: A small but useful tool for landscaping maintenance tasks...

review59.reviewText: I have a deep man-made fish pond in my back yard and have been looking to add a fountain that wouldn't require a lot of rewiring effort and could be done in a few minutes. TheVicTsing 1.4 W Floating Solar Fountain Pumpis an outstanding solution, featuring solar power and easy to put together parts.This unit is just over 6.5" in diameter and goes together quickly. This fountain features 3 (three) different heads to give you variety and options, finding the spray that best meets your tastes and wishes.I took the unit outside to get it setup and it turned on immediately.  I turned it away from the sun until I got to the pond.  I slid the fountain into the pond and it began functioning nicely.  I tested each of the three (3) heads to find the one I liked best; of the different heads, the height varied around 1' up to 1' 6".  Speed and power was varied on sunlight and the particular head I selected.  Being solar dependent, the unit will drop pressure and eventually turn off in shade; it has no battery inside, but then you won't have to change batteries, so that's a good thing.There are so many great uses for theVicTsing 1.4 W Floating Solar Fountain Pump.  This could be fun to add a little flare at a pool party, or to keep the water fresh in a bird bath or pond.Disclosure: I received a sample product from the manufacturer for the purposes of providing this review. A review in exchange for the review sample was not promised. The views and opinions expressed in this review are my own, and in no way represent the views or opinions of the manufacturer or vendor. TL;DR:
review59.summary: Great For Small Water Gardens Or Fish Ponds...
generated: Handy, good design but limited range.

review60.reviewText: I normally don't title my reviews with the name of the product I bought, but I felt the need to with this one because there are several different types (floating, submersible...wattage, you get the idea).I think this is an adorable little birdbath fountain! Very inexpensive and has been working well for about  three weeks. We thoroughly enjoy watching it. When the sun is out. It is extremely sensitive to lack of sunshine ~ even on days where there are a few clouds in the sky ~ if the sun goes away, so does the fountain! I love that it came with several different fountain sprays. My favorite, is actually the shorter, standard type fountain fixture.I've not had trouble with the water being expelled from the bird bath as others have. Even when using the taller fountain fixtures. I love that it keeps the birdbath water circulating ~ keeps it cleaner for a lot longer! Mosquitoes aren't quite here yet, but this should help keep them at bay.This particular pump has little rubber suctions cups that should stick to a bird bath that is GLAZED (maybe painted). My birdbath is concrete and it doesn't stick (I didn't expect it to). However, it sits nicely right in the center and doesn't move. The birdbath needs to be kept filled up so that the pump is submerged at all times or you'll risk burning it out.You need to keep that solar panel up high, facing as much of the sun as possible. I'm fortunate enough to have a 6' PVC fence and perch that panel up leaning on one of the fence post caps and it's perfect! The birds were a bit afraid of it at first, but not they really love it and I actually get birds bathing instead of just drinking, which is a treat for us:)For the price, I think anyone would enjoy this cute little fountain; just don't expect it to work well, or at all, without sunshine! TL;DR:
generated: A small fountain but works well.

review61.reviewText: I confess, I am a Fiskars Fan. I have been since I got my first shovel from them and discovered the joy of having well-made tools.So, just wearing the Fiskars name gets a few stars for me. But here, late in the summer, I had been cutting some low-hanging branches off of my tree. We had a shorter set (don't get me started about Walmart's make it smaller policy) of Bypass Loppers, but these far outshine them. In fact, shortly after spending hours working on the trees using the other shorter loppers, I developed serious shoulder pain and could barely move my arm for several days - a rotator cuff injury of some sort.The lever action makes them easy to use for even the most difficult of tasks in my yard. They keep me from using my shoulder in ways that I shouldn't. And best of all, they are Fiskars, which means they come with a lifetime warranty. I have read other reviews where they have stood  behind the lifetime warranty, so I know they stand behind their word.Seriously cool loppers. Seriously LONG loppers for short people like me, or taller people who need to reach further. TL;DR:
generated: Great Bypass Lopper For Short People

review62.reviewText: This is an exceptional product: well-made, comfortable, light-weight. But most importantly they work wonderfully. I have never had a lopper that performed so well. The branches I have pruned were like butter. This utilizes your force much better than any previous product. It doesn't telescope, but anything within reach or on a ladder will be very easy to prune exactly as you want.We have some huge roses and using a hand pruner is impossible. I cannot wait until spring to try these on our roses. I am sure they will make quick work of what was an onerous/hard job. Bottom-line is the construction makes for the best possible use of your force and the blades cut through branches like tissue. It also has a handy storage piece for the blades that locks into place. Highly recommended. TL;DR:
review62.summary: Great to have in your gardening arsenal; most power in a lopper ever

review63.reviewText: These are pricey but will probably be the last pair of loppers you ever need.  The blades are European steel and continue in one solid piece down the handles, so there are no joints/connections to break.  I have actually broken the handle off cheap loppers.  The steel handles are covered with high-quality aluminum handles, with cork grips at the end.  I was curious about the inclusion of the cork but I suppose it is light and will improve grip, and cork will actually expand a bit when wet to give even better grip.  I do wonder what the cork will be like if it gets chipped years down the road, but the loppers should still mechanically work fine regardless.So how well do they work?  The effort required to cut up to 2" branches is impressively minimal.  I could almost say it's like cutting butter.  To open the blades fully and get the full ~2" cut the handles open almost perpendicular, 4.5 feet wide at the tips.  This allows you to take full advantage of leverage and the gearing.  But opening that wide can also be a disadvantage if space is tight, like when I was cutting dead branches off the trunk of a spruce tree with other nearby prickly branches and needles.Even though they are not heavy for their size they are fairly long, so using them can be a bit of a workout.  If you do a lot of cutting your arms may feel it if you're not in shape.  The actual cutting is surprisingly easy, but just wielding them can be tiring.Overall I'd highly recommend these loppers, they are well-made, strong, and cut with ease.  They should last a lifetime. TL;DR:
generated: A Better Look At What's Included

review64.reviewText: Digging through my barn and tool shed recently I discovered that I have no less than seven loppers at my disposal - loppers I have collected down through the years.  This does not count an untold number of these things that have been loaned to relatives and friends never to be seen again....good grief, I am a push-over.We have several acres of land which include woods, an orchard, flower beds, rose garden and numerous shrubs and trees.  When I received these loppers by Fiskars I immediately put them to work.  As of this writing they have over 28 hours on the.  Trimming, cutting and cleaning is a year around deal at our place and for ever limb or plant that needs trimmed, a dozed more seem to appear over night.So far I have tried these loppers on apple, peach, pear, cherry, oak, hickory, mulberry, locust, wild cherry, Osage orange, large back berry brambles, grape vines and an plethora of trees that I simply do not know the name of.  This lopper has not failed me one time.It does indeed, as advertized, handle limbs up to two inches in diameter.  Hate to use the term, but these loppers go through everything like cutting through soft butter.  They make a very clean cut; a decisive cut and it takes very little effort to do this cutting.  For me the handles are just the right length to give maximum leverage and the cord grips are great.  They actually work even better (the grips) when they become a bit moist with sweat.Two thing to remember about this tool.  First, it works best when the biting end is opened to the widest point...do not try to nip a limb with just the end of the cutting surface.  Second, do remember that the business end of this is steel and even though it is touted at rust resistant...it will never the less rust eventually if not cleaned properly or left out in the elements.  After every use I make sure mine or cleaned and I apply a very, very thin film of three in one oil.  I have done this with all my yard tools over the years and I have some clippers and loppers that have been in constant use since the 1940s and are still going strong.This lopper may seem a bit high ended but if taken care of it will last you a life time and will quire likely be the only lopper you will ever have to buy.Impressive product.Don BlankenshipThe Ozarks TL;DR:
review64.summary: THESE SUDDENLY BECAME MY FAVORE LOPPERS

review65.reviewText: I choose Fiskars brand a lot when I have the choice.  I've chosen their rakes, scissors, loppers and paper cutters.  This Quantum Hand Lopper is replacing a Lopper I had that a neighbor "permanently borrowed" :)Fiskars 9154 PowerGear 32-Inch Bypass Lopper- my fault for lending because they are so amazing that there are always more projects to do with them.  My other Loppers were over 8 years old and holding strong .... but they have found a new home.That said, I decided to try the Cadillac of Loppers!  That would be these, the Quantum Hand Lopper by Fiskars.  This one is different.  It's different with it's cork coated handle that absorbs some of the shock and it's light materials.  The mechanism is flawless and it cuts branches and small trees (2" max) like butter.  The leverage these type of loppers provide is amazing.  The handle takes some of the shock out of the last phase of each cut.  These really are a lighter option too ... and that makes for an easier lopping experience when you are doing it for several cuts.These are superb and you are going to pay for that.  If you take your pruning seriously and need the best tool to lop, buy these.  They are nearly 4X more expensive than others but you do get what you pay for.  Made in Finland with lighter materials and patented gearing technology that multiplies your effort.Fantastic! TL;DR:
generated: Fiskars is a winner on a budget!

review66.reviewText: I had to try these on some limbs that had been annoying me...they were easy to use and I found them strong and durable...I also asked me 80 year old father to take down a limb and he too found them to be simple to use and to not take much effort TL;DR:

review67.reviewText: I'm a professional landscaper and as such, own a variety of loppers, including Corona, Garret Wade's Pro Ratcheting lopper, and the Fiskars PowerGear models which are cheaper but do break more often. This new line of professional loppers is Scandinavian-made, so the metal quality and workmanship is a step above the usual "made in China" tools you'll find at the local hardware store.This lopper has very long handles which makes them a little tough to ease into the interior of rosebushes, for example, but gives you much more leverage when pruning thicker tree branches. The handle length is something to consider when choosing a lopper - short handles get into smaller shrubs easier but require more power to work. This lopper cuts inch-thick woody branches with absolute ease, and because it is bypass-style, it makes a very clean cut that is unlikely to develop disease issues.This lopper is comparable in weight, for its size, to the PowerGear loppers from Fiskars, which is to say it is heavier because it is longer, but not much heavier.
